properties.areaDesc: Coastal Waters of Northern USVI and Culebra out 10 NM; Caribbean Waters of Puerto Rico from 10 NM to 17N; Coastal Waters of Northern Puerto Rico out 10 NM; Mona Passage Southward to 17N; Coastal Waters of Southern USVI, Vieques, and Eastern Puerto Rico out 10 NM; Coastal Waters of Southern Puerto Rico out 10 NM; Coastal Waters OF Northwestern Puerto Rico out 10 NM; Atlantic Waters of Puerto Rico AND USVI from 10 NM to 19.5N; Anegada Passage Southward to 17N
properties.headline: Small Craft Advisory issued January 11 at 7:58AM AST until January 13 at 8:00PM AST by NWS San Juan PR
properties.description:
...Strong easterly winds will continue to cause rough seas...

.Hazardous seas and fresh to strong trade winds are expected
across the regional waters well into next week due to a strong
surface high pressure. Frequent gale-force wind gusts are
expected into this afternoon, especially with fast-moving shower
activity.

* WHAT...For the Gale Warning, east winds around 25 kt with gusts
up to 40 kt and seas 10 to 13 feet. The strongest wind gusts are
expected with fast-moving showers. For the Small Craft
Advisory, east winds 20 to 25 kt with gusts up to 35 kt and seas
9 to 13 feet expected.

* WHERE...Portions of Atlantic coastal waters.

* WHEN...For the Gale Warning, until 5 PM AST this afternoon.
For the Small Craft Advisory, from 5 PM this afternoon to 8 PM
AST Monday.

* IMPACTS...Strong winds will cause hazardous seas which could
capsize or damage vessels and reduce visibility.
properties.instruction:
Mariners should alter plans to avoid these hazardous conditions.
Remain in port, seek safe harbor, alter course, and/or secure the
vessel for severe conditions.

NWSheadline: GALE WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM AST THIS AFTERNOON... ...SMALL CRAFT ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 8 PM AST MONDAY
